intro: Cookia anisata, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while the fruits are berries that turn red when mature. Cookia anisata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
